nodes.bodyText: Why minor? We have been doing a major bump for major WildFly versions.

I thought about this and I'm not sure that change requires a major bump. I'm not modifying the management model in a significant way: there is only 1 flag changed on a single attribute.
I thinks this bug fix fits a minor version bump but if we have required a major bump no matter the changes, I can amend my PR.

The basic reasons we do major version bumps is:

To ensure we always have space for new API versions downstream, in whatever downstream variants we may care about.
KISS principle.

You have a really strong sense of possible downstream needs so I'm happy to defer to your judgement.
I'm fine with keeping a minor bump for that single change... If there were any other changes done to this subsystem before WildFLy 21 is released, then I'll make major bump at that time
